newsitem.title: USA: Adviser to Paul Allen steps down in realignment.
newsitem.headline: Adviser to Paul Allen steps down in realignment.

text.p: Vern Raburn, a top adviser to Microsoft Corp. co-founder Paul Allen, has resigned to pursue other interests, representatives of the multibillionaire entrepreneur said Monday.
Raburn, 47, was chief executive officer of the Paul Allen Group, which is being folded into its parent company, Vulcan Northwest. Raburn could not be reached for comment.
Vulcan Northwest and its investment arm, Vulcan Ventures, will manage Allen's properties and seek new investments, said Allen spokeswoman Susan Pierson.
Allen, with a Microsoft stake valued at more than $14 billion, generally is ranked as the nation's third-richest individual behind Microsoft Chairman Bill Gates and investor Warren Buffett.

Raburn, an early Microsoft employee who went on to help develop the Lotus 1-2-3 spreadsheet programme and played a major role at Symantec Corp., was brought on to help manage Allen's invesments in 1994.

Allen's holdings include major stakes in software company Asymetrix Corp., Internet content provider Starwave Corp., movie studio DreamWorks SKG and the Portland Trail Blazers and Seattle Seahawks professional sports teams.
